tone.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the way your voice sounds, which shows how you are feeling or what you mean
don’t take that tone with me (=do not speak to me in that rude or unpleasant way)
tone.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Her tone was sharp with anger.
It was obvious from her tone of voice that she didn’t like me.
‘You must be Annie, ’ he said in a friendly tone.
There was urgency in his tone.
tone.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the quality of a sound, especially the sound of a musical instrument or someone’s voice
tone.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: ‘No I didn’t, ’ he said in a low tone (=quietly).
tone.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the general feeling or attitude expressed in a piece of writing, a speech, an activity etc
tone.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The meetings were noted for their deeply religious tone.
Opening remarks are important since they set the tone for the rest of the interview.
The tone of the report was radical.
The article was moderate in tone.
tone.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: one of the many types of a particular colour, each slightly darker, lighter, brighter etc than the next
tone.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Perhaps a darker tone would be better.
your skin tone (=the colour of your skin)
The dried colour is slightly deeper in tone than it appears when first applied.
tone.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a sound made by electronic equipment, such as a telephone
engaged tone British English,  busy tone American English (=the sound you hear when you telephone someone but they are already talking to someone else)
tone.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Please leave a message after the tone.
tone.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: how firm and strong your muscles or skin are
tone.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: A regular brisk walk will improve muscle tone.
tone.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: the difference in pitch between two musical notes that are separated by one key on the piano
tone.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: how high or low your voice is when you produce different sounds
tone.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: There is a falling tone on the first syllable and a rising tone on the other.
tone.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: I tried to keep my tone pleasant and conversational.
She used a more conciliatory tone.
His tone was matter-of-fact, but she noticed he was shaking.
He spoke slowly, in a calm and measured tone.
Davis’s secretary informed him in clipped tones: ‘Mr Davis is not here.’
They sat at the far end of the carriage, talking in hushed tones.
I could hear Martha’s dulcet tones bellowing that dinner was ready.
Try talking to the child in a firm but soothing tone of voice.
tone.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to improve the strength and firmness of your muscles, skin etc
tone.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Exercise can strengthen and tone muscles.
He began to use weights in order to tone up his body.
